channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report E-2025030395
item.description:
Report E-2025030395

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: CLARION
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental-LTL personnel arrived onsite and observed that an estimated five (5) gallons were released impacting an estimated 2’-by-2’ area. The released material was due to a load shift causing one (1) 5-gallon metal pail to be punctured. Once the telehandler arrived, they started unloading freight. They ceased work due to being unable to unload/reload a metal grate with product on it with the manpower and equipment they had. However, the driver called his safety manager who dispatched two drivers who had power pallet jackets to assist with moving the metal grate. If loaded in the original position, the freight risked puncturing another product. It was determined the metal grate should be taken on another truck instead of being reloaded in the same position. First Call Environmental-LTL deployed absorbents and containerized them into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. All undamaged freight was loaded onto a new truck while the metal grate was loaded onto the original truck. Due to First Call Environmental-LTL not being able to hold hazardous waste, they took the generated waste the ESTES terminal in West Middlesex, Pennsylvania. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025030048
item.description:
Report I-2025030048

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: Philadelphia
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 15:00, a passenger approached the, #5 flight attendant with a vape device that was actively heating up. The passenger stated that he had accidentally dropped the device in water in the Lavatory, causing it to malfunction. The#5 flight attendant immediately informed the purser.- The purser communicated the situation to the flight deck crew and attempted to locate the fire containment bag.- When the purser was unable to locate the bag, the#4 flight attendant took over the search.- Meanwhile, the#7 flight attendant(myself) and the#5 flight attendant proceeded to fill the containment bag with water.- Once located, the malfunctioning vape device was placed inside the containment bag and submerged in water to prevent further overheating or potential fire: The containment bag was sealed according to standard safety procedures.-The secured device was then stored in an empty cart in the aft galley for the remainder of the flight. The situation was successfully managed without further incident. The device remained stable inside the containment bag, and there were no reported safety concerns for passengers or crew.

item.title: Report E-2025030345
item.description:
Report E-2025030345

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking metal drum containing hazardous product, Nitric Acid. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimate 1-pint release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area as a result of improper packaging. The contractor applied sodium bicarbonate to the release and applied oil dry as well as absorbent pads. The neutralized and impacted absorbents and PPE were containerized into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025030299
item.description:
Report E-2025030299

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-16
  • City: EIGHTY FOUR
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an area measuring approximately 15ft-by-20ft of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that thirty (30) gallons of material was released due to one (1) 275-gallon poly tote being crushed and punctured by a forklift. Clean Harbors personnel deployed granular absorbents and used absorbent pads to collect the spent material. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote. The damaged tote was cut-up and along with the recovered spent absorbents were placed into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025030986
item.description:
Report X-2025030986

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-17
  • City: NEW STANTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE BLOCKS COOLING FOOD. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINS NON-REGULATED ULINE COLD PACKS COOLING THE FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM PENNSYLVANIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER GG8840, THE UPS STORE, 1070 MOUNTAIN LAUREL PLZ, LATROBE PA 15650-5214. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
